result.execSummary:
The defendant Omeeka S Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: AS TO EACH COUNT, COUNTS ONE, TWO AND THREE:  Consecutive to each count and any other sentence.  Straight time.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Cour waived all nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges.
Court advised that under 48USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after convictin of a crime of domestic violence.
Mental health evaluation.  Take all presribed medications.

No contact with D.M.L. unless approved by Children's Court or BMCW.
No contact with firearms.

Course in anger management.
Parenting classes (completed).
Absolute sobriety.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
*Probation conditions apply to all counts/case
*With approval of DOC agent and after 15 months of probation and conclusion of all programming and payment of fees, defendant can petition the Court for early release  from probation.

timeConds.notes:
01-26-16/ Judge Jeffrey Kremers
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 100 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time, in the HOC. 

**11-20-15/ Judge Jeffrey A Kremers**
The Court ordered that the HOC time ordered as condition time, is stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
The Court found that the defendant is unable to pay the DNA and DV surcharges on all three counts.   The Court ordered the DNA and DV surcharges are reduced, and are to be paid on Count 1 only. 


100 days as to each count.  STAYED pending review hearing.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive.  As  stated in count one.

records.addlTxt:
Received, signed and filed:
Order.
Copy forwarded to parties on today's date.
cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, calendar successor, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges.
Reflects 01-26-16 Court order imposing 100 days of condition time

Attorney Jeffry R Schwartz in court.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant was not produced for today's date.
  DOC agent Corrine Norman also in court.
The defense informs the court that he has gone over the memo with his client.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 100 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  The condition time is effective as of 01/01/2016.  Defendant is currently in custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
Copy given to the agent in court.
The court will not schedule another probation review hearing.  If the defendant has additional violations, she should contact the court to bring the defendant back into court.
Defense counsel's request for huber work release at this time will be denied.  Defendant has lost his job. 
If the defendant obtains new employment or will participat in work detail, he should write to the court to ask for those privileges.

Agent contacted the court and is requesting a hearing date.
Case calendared for a probation review hearing in Branch 36 on 01/26/2016 at 08:30 a.m.
Attorney Schwartz will be appearing on behalf of the defendant.
cab

The court will not sign any commitment orders without a hearing.  Clerk left a voice mail message informing her to call the court to schedule the hearing.
File and paperwork returned to the Clerk of Court's Office.
cab

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Kremers
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ x  ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment
Reflects 11-20-15 Court order to STAY condition time for agents use and reducing DV & DNA surcharges to Count one only

Defendant Omeeka S Scott in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
 DOC agent also in court.
The court found that the defendant is unable to pay the DNA surcharge on all 3 counts.  Reduced to 1 count.  The same thing on the DV surcharge, the court reduced it to 1 count.  The Clerk of Court's Office is to correct the total costs and surcharges and modify the payables as instructed by the court.
 
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive each count and any other sentence, with credit for 8 DAYS time served, straight time.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive each count and any other sentence, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive each count and any other sentence, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 100 DAYS (as to each count) as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-A course in anger management.
-Parenting classes  (completed).
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with D.M.L., unless approved by children's court or BMCW.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-No physical discipline of any children.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence. 
*With approval of DOC agent and after 15 MONTHS of probation and conclusion of all programming and payment of fees, defendant can petition the court for early release form probation.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

AS TO COUNT 1, 2 & 3
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Omeeka S Scott in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. Received & Filed, Amended Information. Defense provided copy, waived reading. Amended Information reads: 
COUNT 1: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), a class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 2: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), a class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 3: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), a class A Misdemeanor.
Court modified the no contact order to a NO VIOLENT CONTACT ORDER.  No implements to be used for punishment.  Defendant cannot discuss the case with the victim.

Defendant Omeeka S Scott in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 23.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Defense would like more time so she can complete more counselling.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Omeeka S Scott in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Omeeka S Scott in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for Molly Schmidt for the State of Wisconsin.  
Br. 4 for Br. 23.   
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Offer will be forwarded to defense counsel by ADA Molly Schmidt, per ADA Abbey DeSiato.  Defense Motion to Modify the No Contact Order is heard and denied by the Court.   mld
Branch 23 is in trial, case spun to Judge Flanagan branch 04.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Aaron L, and his children, including DML, DOB 4/5/10.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Omeeka S Scott in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Omeeka S Scott in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary Hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30pm.

There was discussion over if the case was correctly assigned to the Domestic Violence Court. Commissioner stated that this could be taken before the Judge.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
